interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2020/09/22
Average Rating: 4.2
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ari Aster'], 'Producers': ['Patrik Andersson', 'Thomas Benski', 'Tyler Campellone', 'Scott E. Chester', 'Beau Ferris', 'Fredrik Heinig', 'Lars Knudsen', 'Pelle Nilsson', 'Jeffrey Penman'], 'Starring': ['Florence Pugh', 'Jack Reynor', 'William Jackson Harper'], 'Studio': ['A24 Distribution LLC']}
Review Text: I love this movie because it has every element a true horror film should have. Unsettling atmosphere, brow-shifting moments, creepy scenes that make you thankful for not having to experience them yourself, disturbing characters that make your skin crawl- you name it. I’m a horror fan and honestly I don’t do well with watching this alone, even in daylight. I highly recommend Midsommar to anyone who loves being weirded/freaked out or enjoys thought-provoking subjects. By the way, this is a movie that you need to actually watch from start to finish (as well as pay attention to the small details).. so set aside time, put down the phone, and prepare yourself for this bizarre ride!
Review Title: Incredibly dark and thrilling!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Heaven's Lost Property - The Angeloid of Clockwork (Blu-ray/DVD Combo)
Brittany Karbowski  (Actor),     Greg Ayres  (Actor),     Christopher Bevins  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Anime
['Product Description', 'BR/DVD.', 'Amazon.com', 'Although the', "Heaven's Lost Property", 'feature', 'The Angeloid of Clockwork', "(2011) was released theatrically, it plays like a choppy series of OVA adventures cut together. Pretty high school student Hiyori Kazane nurtures a crush on Tomoki. She watches him with his friend Sohara and the Angeloids, but she's too shy to say anything to him. The first half of the movie echoes the original series: Tomoki and his friends go about their usual misadventures around town and at local festivals. The filmmakers include plenty of jiggle shots and underwear jokes. At one point, the girls' panties fly away like a swarm of butterflies, although the viewer never learns why. The last third of the film turns serious: apparently Hiyori is dreaming her everyday adventures while her body lies in the facility known as Synapse. When she's hit by a truck, Hiyori dies in her dream and reenters her real body. She wants to come back to Sorami so intensely, she returns as an Angeloid--to destroy Tomoki. The tragic romance plays oddly against the gross jokes. During much of the film, Tomoki is drawn as a sort of toy-avatar who argues with himself on the toilet and rides the conveyor belt in a sushi bar, naked on a plastic tray. Although", "Heaven's Lost Property", 'has proved popular on both sides of the Pacific,', 'otaku', "who watch it for the fan service shots probably won't enjoy the ill-starred romance, and romantics will be put off by the raw jokes. (Rated TV MA: risqué humor, toilet humor, nudity, cartoon violence, violence against women)", '--Charles Solomon']
{'Genre': 'Anime & Manga', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Color, Widescreen, Animated', 'Contributor': 'Brittany Karbowski, Jamie Marchi, Christopher Bevins, Eric Vale, Greg Ayres', 'Language': 'Japanese, English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.77:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.47 Ounces', 'Item model number': '704400058837', 'Director': 'Christopher Bevins', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Color, Widescreen, Animated', 'Run time': '1 hour and 35 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 26, 2013', 'Actors': 'Brittany Karbowski, Greg Ayres, Eric Vale, Jamie Marchi', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Funimation Prod', 'Number of discs': '2'}
This is probably the most funny and cutest anime me and my hubs have ever seen. It's packed with pervy stuff, cuteness, and humor. This anime will strike the heartstrings and make your sides hurt from laughing too hard. It's perfectly scripted and made- it's just too much perfection in one show. Daisuki!
Sora no Otoshimono/Heaven's Lost Property...
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Aneesh Chaganty'], 'Producers': ['Timur Bekmambetov', 'Sev Ohanian', 'Natalie Qasabian', 'Adam Sidman'], 'Starring': ['John Cho', 'Debra Messing', 'Joseph Lee'], 'Studio': ['Screen Gems']}
The second I saw the trailer for this in theaters, I was beyond excited to see it. I was not disappointed at all and can’t wait to watch it again. It’s one of those movies where you’ll be playing detective in your head and think you have the right answer only to become stumped the next minute and second guess yourself. I highly recommend giving this a watch, you won’t regret it!
Keeps you curious!

It is a great movie although it’s a little too quirky for my taste. I recommend it to anyone wanting to laugh!
Funny!

{'Audio languages': ['English (US) [Audio Description]', 'English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Gary Dauberman'], 'Producers': ['Richard Brener', 'Michael Clear', 'Michelle Morrissey', 'Dave Neustadter', 'Victoria Palmeri', 'Peter Safran', 'Judson Scott', 'James Wan'], 'Starring': ['Vera Farmiga', 'Patrick Wilson', 'Mckenna Grace']}
It was okay, a bit all over the place. I wouldn’t watch again or buy it, but I’d recommend for people to watch at least once if they’re a fan of the Conjuring universe.
Not awful, not great...

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preference:** The user enjoys anime that combines humor, romance, and fanservice with suspenseful thrillers, alongside a newfound appreciation for horror films that feature unsettling atmospheres and intricate narratives.

- **Content Style:** Prefers lighthearted, comedic works with quirky characters but is now also drawn to darker, thought-provoking horror that evokes strong emotional responses. They appreciate intricate plots stimulating critical thinking and have become more discerning regarding storytelling cohesion.

- **Quality Appreciation:** Values well-crafted storytelling and high production quality, as evidenced by their recent positive review of a horror film centered on atmospheric tension and character depth. They emphasize the need for engaging narratives that challenge the viewer.

- **Experience Seeking:** Aims for emotional experiences that evoke both laughter and intensity, enjoying narratives that balance comedy with suspense and horror that offers psychological complexity.

- **Social Viewing:** Enjoys shared viewing experiences that enhance enjoyment, especially with humor and romance but also for thrillers and horror films that spark conversation about their deeper themes.

- **Product Format:** Prefers high-quality media formats, such as Blu-ray, to ensure an optimal viewing experience across various genres.

Overall, the user is drawn to engaging content that fuses comedy, romance, and horror while valuing intricate narratives, quality production, and a critical approach to storytelling.
